name: smrnaseq-novel-discovery
title: Novel miRNA Discovery (nf-core/smrnaseq)
description: Discover novel, previously unannotated microRNAs using the nf-core/smrnaseq pipeline with MIRDeep2. Identify species-specific, tumor-specific, or tissue-specific miRNAs in non-model organisms and specialized biological contexts. Deep sequencing recommended for robust novel miRNA prediction. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
Novel miRNA Discovery

The nf-core/smrnaseq pipeline with MIRDeep2 discovers novel, previously unannotated microRNAs from small RNA sequencing data. This app identifies species-specific miRNAs, tumor-specific miRNAs in cancer, or miRNAs in non-model organisms where annotation is incomplete.

What This Pipeline Does

  • Novel miRNA Prediction: MIRDeep2 identifies potential new miRNAs
  • Hairpin Structure Analysis: Predicts characteristic miRNA precursor structures
  • Expression Quantification: Counts both known and novel miRNAs
  • Confidence Scoring: Statistical scores for novel predictions
  • Known miRNA Profiling: Standard quantification alongside discovery
  • Comprehensive QC: miRTrace and MultiQC reports

Scientific Applications

Use Cases:

  • Non-Model Organisms: Species without complete miRNA annotation
  • Cancer Research: Tumor-specific or oncogenic miRNAs
  • Evolutionary Studies: Species-specific miRNA evolution
  • Tissue-Specific Discovery: Specialized cell type miRNAs
  • Viral miRNAs: Virus-encoded miRNAs in infected cells
  • Plant Biology: Plant-specific miRNA families

Input Requirements

Provide a CSV samplesheet:

  • sample: Unique sample identifier
  • fastq_1: Path/URL to single-end FASTQ file

Sequencing Depth for Discovery:

  • Minimum: 10 million reads per sample
  • Recommended: 20-50 million reads per sample
  • Deep sequencing increases discovery sensitivity
  • Multiple samples improve validation

MIRDeep2 Discovery Process

  1. Mapping: Align reads to reference genome
  2. Hairpin Prediction: Identify genomic loci with characteristic miRNA hairpin structures
  3. Read Stacking: Analyze read coverage patterns (5p and 3p arms)
  4. Scoring: Statistical significance of predictions
  5. Filtering: Remove low-confidence predictions

Key Outputs

  • Novel miRNAs: mirdeep2/novel_mature.fa - Predicted novel miRNA sequences
  • Novel Hairpins: mirdeep2/novel_precursors.fa - Precursor structures
  • Result Summary: mirdeep2/result.html - HTML report with predictions and confidence scores
  • Expression Matrix: Combined known + novel miRNA counts
  • Known miRNAs: edger/counts.tsv - Standard miRNA quantification
  • QC Reports: MultiQC and miRTrace quality assessment

Understanding MIRDeep2 Scores

Novel miRNA predictions include confidence scores:

  • Score >10: High confidence, likely genuine miRNA
  • Score 5-10: Medium confidence, requires validation
  • Score 0-5: Low confidence, likely false positive
  • Negative scores: Very low confidence, exclude

Recommendation: Focus on predictions with score >5 for experimental validation.

Experimental Validation

Novel miRNAs require experimental confirmation:

  1. Northern Blot: Gold standard for miRNA validation
  2. qPCR: Quantitative validation with specific primers
  3. RNA-seq in Independent Samples: Biological validation
  4. Functional Studies: Target identification and functional analysis

Quality Metrics

Good Discovery Dataset:

  • ✓ Deep sequencing: >10M reads per sample
  • ✓ High miRNA content: >50% miRNA mapping
  • ✓ Low contamination: <5% rRNA
  • ✓ Multiple samples: Increases confidence in predictions
  • ✓ Peak at 22nt: Characteristic miRNA length distribution

Species Considerations

  • Well-Annotated Species (human, mouse): Fewer novel discoveries expected
  • Non-Model Organisms: More novel discoveries, use closest related species code
  • Tissue-Specific: Novel miRNAs may be tissue-restricted
  • Cancer/Disease: Tumor-specific miRNAs can be discovered

Computational Resources

Important: Novel miRNA discovery is computationally intensive.

  • SMALL: Testing with limited samples
  • MEDIUM: Recommended for discovery studies (5-20 samples)
  • LARGE: Large-scale discovery (>20 samples)

Runtime: 30-60 minutes per sample (longer than standard profiling)

Expected Discovery Rates

  • Human/Mouse: 0-10 novel miRNAs (most are already annotated)
  • Non-Model Organisms: 10-100+ novel miRNAs
  • Cancer Samples: 5-20 tumor-specific miRNAs
  • Rare Tissues: 5-30 tissue-specific miRNAs

Downstream Analysis

After discovering novel miRNAs:

  1. Validate Expression: Confirm by qPCR or Northern blot
  2. Conservation Analysis: Check conservation across species
  3. Target Prediction: Identify mRNA targets (TargetScan, miRanda)
  4. Functional Studies: Overexpression or knockdown experiments
  5. Submit to miRBase: Contribute validated miRNAs to community database

Important Notes

  • MIRDeep2 requires reference genome (cannot use pre-built indices only)
  • Predictions are computational - experimental validation required
  • Multiple biological replicates strengthen confidence
  • Low-confidence predictions should be interpreted cautiously

Perfect for: Non-model organism researchers • Cancer biologists • Plant scientists • Evolutionary biologists • Virology • Discovery research

Built with Nextflow • Powered by nf-core/smrnaseq v2.4.0 • MIRDeep2 prediction • Publication-ready results

spec.description: CSV file with columns: sample, fastq_1. Deep sequencing recommended (>10M reads per sample) for robust novel miRNA discovery.

spec.label: Output Directory
spec.name: outdir
spec.description: Directory where all results will be saved, including novel miRNA predictions, hairpin structures, confidence scores, and validation data.

spec.label: Reference Genome
spec.name: genome
spec.description: Reference genome for your organism. Required for MIRDeep2 to identify genomic loci with miRNA hairpin structures.

spec.label: Species Code (miRTrace)
spec.name: species
spec.description: Species code for quality control. For non-model organisms, use closest related species.
